name: James S. Plank
content: James S. Plank James S. Plank Professor, Dept. of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, University of Tennessee Mailing Address: EECS Department, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN 37996 Email: jplank@utk.edu Office: 320 Min Kao Phone: (865) 974-4397 (However, I'm really never near that phone. If you want to reach me by phone, the best thing is to email me and we'll schedule a call.) Fax: (865) 974-5483 This page: http://web.eecs.utk.edu/~jplank Technical Stuff Jim Plank is a Professor of EECS at the University of Tennessee. Professor Plank received his Ph.D. from Princeton University in 1993, under the direction of the incomparable Kai Li. His research interests are currently focused on neuromorphic computing: models, software, hardware and applications. Here is the web site of our group - Neuromorphic UT. Dr. Plank also has expertise in erasure codes for storage applications, network storage, RAID, fault-tolerance, checkpointing, distributed and grid computing, systems programming and operating systems. Less related to his job at Tennessee, he also has interests in duplicate bridge, computer-mediated music performance, origami, and jgraph. He has been at the University of Tennessee since January, 1993. Links Research Papers Teaching External Funding Software: Jerasure, GF-Complete, plus jgraph, IBP/LoRS, libckpt, red-black trees, dlists Students Online Vita If I have agreed to write a recommendation letter for you Non-technical stuff Pictures Origami My Summer Student Gallery 2024Nick Skuda (g), Simon Levy (research professor), Daniel Mallett (u), Dr. P., Charlie Rizzo (research professor), Bryson Gullett (g), Jamin Hanna (u), Chris White (u). 2023I didn't take a group picture this summer, so you get a head-shot collage.
